data.title: American Impact Capital
data.text:
To amplify the impact of philanthropic capital by investing in groundbreaking companies whose values and business goals are aligned with the 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

We invest philanthropic capital in private companies with social and environmental impact.

We invest on the recommendation of our donors in their chosen cause areas.

We provide a new funding channel for entrepreneurs.

Take a business-minded approach to their philanthropy.

Champion visionary entrepreneurs commercializing groundbreaking ideas.

Engage their family in a multi-generational philanthropic legacy.

Know their philanthropic funds are being leveraged through co-investment.

Invest in innovation in a financially intelligent and tax-efficient way.

Built six multi-billion-dollar asset platforms at U.S. Trust and Bank of America. Grew investment firm from $300 million to over $5 billion in six years.

Increased charitable assets by over $5 billion within eight years. Past clients include: MIT Solve, Save the Children, USC, Foundation Group, X-Prize, and Mongabay.

Former Senior Medical Advisor to the White House, NASA, and HHS. Founder and CEO of SolaMed Solutions. Founder of iGIANT, the world’s only accelerator for gendered innovation. Columbia, NYU.

Served over three hundred families with $500 million directed to philanthropy. Editor-in-Chief of Planned Giving Design Center, the largest PG library in the world.

Producer, actor, writer, director. Known for Thirtysomething, Grey’s Anatomy, The Cure, Who Killed the Electric Car?, American Odyssey, The Philanthropist, and New Amsterdam. Emmy nominee, Producer’s Guild winner, Golden Globe winner.

25 years in music and entertainment as VP of Distribution and Senior VP Marketing for Universal Music Group. Co-founder, Ten Foot Hedge Productions. Talent management, marketing, Executive Producer of series, documentaries. Clients: Special Olympics, Comic-con, World Team Tennis. Wayne State University.

Former organized crime prosecutor turned environmental crime prosecutor. Founder, Environmental Health Foundation, endorsed by Robert Kennedy, Jr. and Vice President Al Gore. Victim and survivor of environmental poisoning. Legal champion for the rights of victims.

Creator of high-value strategic collaborations in social impact areas of the environment, climate change, energy, education, health, and empowerment of women. Project fundraising for causes of Sir Richard Branson, the Dalai Lama, Charlize Theron, Queen Noor, and Jane Goodall.

Over a decade at the nexus of media, technology, social impact, and public health. Production Executive at CurrentTV - Al Gore's initiative to "re-democratize the media." Producer at LinkTV.org, the largest non-profit channel in the U.S., Executive VP at Spielberg's Dreamscape Immersive.

Classically trained virtuoso cellist. Recipient of The Prince Charles Award for Musical Excellence. Performed for 23 years with Nobel Peace Laureate His Holiness the Dalai Lama; Musical Keynote for Pope Francis. Aspen Music Fellowship. Music Director, Muhammad Ali Humanitarian Awards.

21 years in entertainment, technology and nonprofit fundraising. Worked with Oprah Winfrey, Hugh Jackman, and Jerry Bruckheimer. Head of Operations at CharityStars and Prizeo. Founder, We Do Launch with clients such as Charitybuzz, Global Citizen, the Red Cross, and Malaria No More.
